p: In the 19 th century, the discovery of quinine, extracted from the bark of Cinchona pubescens Vahl, represented a milestone in the history of modern medicine for malaria [ 1]. In 1971, in China, a new antimalarial drug, artemisinin, was discovered from the extracts of Artemisia annua L., a plant used in Chinese traditional medicine to treat fever-related diseases [ 4, 5, 6]. With this finding, in 2015 Professor Youyou Tu, the principal investigator, won the Nobel prize of medicine [ 7].
